_metadata.description: Sweltering Passages Area - reorganized from World1 export

rooms.long_description:
This tunnel has been eroded from fossil rich rock. The air is humid
and hot. Steam rises from many small holes through the walls and floor.
The exits are to the southwest and up.

room_flags.note: Bitwise OR of flag values from _enumerations.room_flags

rooms.long_description:
This passage is huge and extremely hot. The walls are made of volcanic rock
run through with veins of some chalky black mineral which flakes off easily.
You can exit to the north and southeast.

room_flags.note: Bitwise OR of flag values from _enumerations.room_flags

rooms.long_description:
This passage is huge and extremely hot. The walls are made of volcanic rock
run through with veins of some chalky black mineral which flakes off easily.
You can exit to the northeast, south, and northwest.

room_flags.note: Bitwise OR of flag values from _enumerations.room_flags

rooms.long_description:
This passage is huge and extremely hot. The walls are made of volcanic rock
run through with veins of some chalky black mineral which flakes off easily.
You can exit to the southeast and west.

room_flags.note: Bitwise OR of flag values from _enumerations.room_flags

rooms.long_description:
You are standing in a surprisingly orderly complex of natural caverns which
form wide passageways and large, spacious chambers with few stalagtites or
stalagmites blocking open areas. The floor here is unnaturally smooth and
level despite the apparent origin of these caverns. You may exit to the
north, southeast, or to the west.

room_flags.note: Bitwise OR of flag values from _enumerations.room_flags

rooms.long_description:
This passage is huge and extremely hot. The walls are made of volcanic rock
run through with veins of some chalky black mineral which flakes off easily.
You can exit to the east and west.

room_flags.note: Bitwise OR of flag values from _enumerations.room_flags

rooms.long_description:
Glowing orbs set in the walls give off an eerie yellow light. The high
vaulted ceiling is supported by huge columns set at regular intervals.
Exits lie to the northeast, southwest, and northwest.

rooms.long_description:
This tunnel has been eroded from fossil rich rock. The air is humid
and hot. Steam rises from many small holes through the walls and floor.
The exits are to the southwest and up.
